title: (Pwn2Own) NETGEAR R6700v3 readycloud_control.cgi Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of NETGEAR R6700v3 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within readycloud_control.cgi. The issue results from the lack of authentication prior to allowing access to functionality. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: NETGEAR has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://kb.netgear.com/000064722/Security-Advisory-for-Sensitive-Information-Disclosure-on-Some-Routers-and-Fixed-Wireless-Products-PSV-2021-0325
timeline:
2021-12-01 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-03-23 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Xin'an Zhou, Xiaochen Zou, Zhiyun Qian (from the team NullRiver)
